name: Novotel Rennes Alma

reviews.text: I stayed a week in Rennes, and chose the Alma because it fit my expense budget and had pretty good reviews online. I don't ask for much, but I was underwhelmed, especially in the light of several colleagues staying in Novatel Centre Gare, Mercure Parliment, Mercure Centre Gare, which are more posh and friendly hotels, with more modern accommodations.
reviews.title: There is better in Rennes
Good night's sleep
reviews.text: The Alma feels like a step back into the 80's with an old Howard Johnson, actual keys for room entry, a bit of mold in the bathroom vents and a room door that for two days in a row (Monday and Tuesday), wasn't shut all the way.

reviews.title: Old and dated hotel for expensive price - Novotel, Alma, Rennes
reviews.text: This hotel is a 1980's relic, the rooms are very clean but a little over painted and dated. The space between the double bed if you pick the wall side is about 9 inches so be prepared to climb over the bed. Comfortable mattress and pillows but air con non existant. When my husband asked Reception if it could be turned down they said they had turned it off as it was very cold outside ! hello this is August Bank Holiday Saturday and its 21C outside and does'nt drop over night. The in room bar/fridge was hardly cold enough to cool a bottle of Fanta never mind chill it. Outside area was clean and play area for children good, pool clean but no person visibly took the challenge to swim or sunbathe. Car parking was adequate and close to Carrefour and Casino restaurant if you prefer something less formal or expensive than Hotel restaurant. Situation is super for overnight to pick up major routes but as this hotel is usually 102€ plus 10€ for an animal its over priced. Other brands within same group of Accor and other brands close by better value. We pass Rennes every month and thought it might be an interesting city as its the Brittany parliament but apart from the timber framed houses and the Saturday morning market alot of the centre has an abandoned air many shops empty and a few restaurants with pavement seating. I was hoping to enjoy the fact two major waterways joined here but nothing interesting at all - much more interesting walks further out near Hede and Montreuil sur Ille has more to offer in scenery and walks.

reviews.title: Very comfortable for an overnight stay
reviews.text: I chose this hotel as 2 overnight stops before a long journey to and from the Pyrennees.

reviews.title: good hotel, with comfortable rooms
reviews.text: It is situated just off the Rennes ringroad next to Alma shopping centre so it is easy to find.

reviews.title: Holiday Stopover
reviews.text: Hadn't visited this hotel for a few years. Has been refurbished but still no lift to upper floor so don't have heavy baggage! Staff were welcoming and attentive and there was no wait for service in bar or restaurant, which was a problem in past. Food of fast variety in very modern setting. Large car park with security gates. Located opposite Carrefour Hypermarket.

reviews.title: Will try somewhere else next time
reviews.text: Have stayed before because of the location, a short bus ride into Rennes. Next time we'll try somewhere else. Room was not cleaned properly and was also very shabby. Shower was for short, very thin people only, and cafe/restaurant overpriced. Not very good value for money all round. Stayed in lovely Mecure in Honfleur on same trip so will try that next time we need this sort of chain accommodation.

reviews.title: Great up until checkout!
reviews.text: Stayed in a standard room kids were on a sofabed which made things a little tight when the beds were out - otherwise room size was fine. Bathroom was lovely looked as though it had recently been upgraded - nice walk in wet room style shower and modern sink/mirror etc.

A perfect stop over if you are on your way to somewhere else. Rooms are clean, comfortable and of a good size, having obviously had a make over since we stayed here 3 years ago. The food is better than many Novotels (but still very, very basic) and there is plenty of fairly secure parking.You are literally 2 minutes away from the main road if going south or north. BUT you are next to a shopping centre and there is nowhere to go in the evening unless you get back into your car. But this is not a holiday hotel - it is simply a good place for an overnight stop on your way to somewhere else which is why we have used it a few times.
reviews.title: Good hotel despite being in a shopping centre
Smoker avoid this hotel.
reviews.text: I am most disappointed by this hotel. I cannot believe about the worst well come I had. Because I ask for a smoking room, the hotel try to convince me about another hotel. The hotel was full and they were looking for more rooms. Then they realized I was platinum then they offer me the worst room they had. I did not get my free drink. The worst experience I had. Avoid this hotel by any means.
I've stayed at this hotel with the family on a few occasions and it always hits the mark. The rooms & bathrooms are clean and just fine for an overnight stop.
reviews.title: Convenient hotel of consistent quality

description: The Novotel Rennes Alma is located 3 km from the TGV station and a 15 min drive from the airport. On the doorstep of Brittany, this is an ideal location for those on a business trip to Rennes. This 3 star hotel is located on the Rennes southern ring roadand offers 100 quiet, refurbished, airconditioned rooms. The hotel also features several meeting rooms for up to 120 people. The Novotel Cafe invites you to experience contemporary dining while room service is available from 7 p.m. to midnight.
